moves.1. e3:
I am black   and frederickrose is white.
easy game and nice win.
I felt white did not know what he was doing.
moves.1... Nf6: I thought I should try a new opening this game. what is this opening?
moves.2. Bc4: building his bishops. some one said its all ways better to build your knights first.
moves.2... Nc6: done with building up my knights
moves.3. Qf3: you moving your queen too early  in the game.
moves.3... b6: clearing the way for my bishop
moves.5... Nxc4: that what happens when you forget about a piece
moves.6. b3: I just know he will forget about knight I fell  safe leaving my knight where it is.
moves.7. Ng5: I do not think white has a plan
moves.7... Nxa3: I was right about he forgetting about the knight.
moves.8. Bxa3: at least he did something right.
moves.9. Nh3: he learns  not to  forget about his pieces
moves.10. d4: this will lead to a check
moves.10... c5: moving this pawn to get ready for a check
moves.12. Nf4: I have a winning edge on him.
moves.13... g5: gets ready to take the knight
moves.14. Kc3: bad move the king is in   open space with little protection.
moves.15... Nh5: my next goal is to get that queen out of the game.
moves.16... Nxf4: This player has a habit  of forgetting about his pieces.
moves.17... Rc8+: Its over for white and he lose big time.
moves.19... O-O: castle   that was to give me time to come up with a checkmate plan. checkmate is 3 moves from here
moves.20... Ne2: moving in to help with the check mate.
moves.22... Bd3#: checkmate  a  good trio  when it comes to checkmates are your 2 bishops and a knight.
